DataElement.preferredName: Study Protocol Investigational New Drug Or Investigational Medical Device Exemption Flag Holder Type Code HolderType
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.:A new drug or biological drug that is used in a clinical investigation. The term also includes a biological product that is used in vitro for diagnostic purposes.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A device that is the subject of clinical investigation or research to determine the safety or effectiveness of the device. Investigational devices include transitional devices (21 CFR 812.3(r)) that are objects of investigations. An investigational device may be an approved device that is being studied for an unapproved use or efficacy.:Immunity from an obligation or duty.:An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true._A person who has physical possession or legal rights to something.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation._The code that identifies the holder of the Investigational New Drug (IND) or the Investigational New Device (IDE) for this Protocol.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Study Protocol Investigational New Drug Or Investigational Medical Device Exemption Flag
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.:A new drug or biological drug that is used in a clinical investigation. The term also includes a biological product that is used in vitro for diagnostic purposes.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A device that is the subject of clinical investigation or research to determine the safety or effectiveness of the device. Investigational devices include transitional devices (21 CFR 812.3(r)) that are objects of investigations. An investigational device may be an approved device that is being studied for an unapproved use or efficacy.:Immunity from an obligation or duty.:An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

Concepts.definition: A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.
A new drug or biological drug that is used in a clinical investigation. The term also includes a biological product that is used in vitro for diagnostic purposes.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

A device that is the subject of clinical investigation or research to determine the safety or effectiveness of the device. Investigational devices include transitional devices (21 CFR 812.3(r)) that are objects of investigations. An investigational device may be an approved device that is being studied for an unapproved use or efficacy.
Immunity from an obligation or duty.
An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

Property.preferredDefinition: A person who has physical possession or legal rights to something.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

Concepts.definition: A person who has physical possession or legal rights to something.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 7/22/2021wz: released for UML model cleanup project.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The code that identifies the holder of the Investigational New Drug (IND) or the Investigational New Device (IDE) for this Protocol.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The people or companies engaged in a particular kind of commercial enterprise; the organized action of making of goods and services for sale.

Concepts.definition: The people or companies engaged in a particular kind of commercial enterprise; the organized action of making of goods and services for sale.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: a researcher in a clinical trial or clinical study.

Concepts.definition: An individual who conducts scientific research. In a clinical setting this individual actually conducts and/or supervises the clinical investigation and study-related procedures.  The investigator monitors the safety of the trial subjects and investigational staff (under whose immediate direction an agent is administered or dispensed to a subject).  The investigator collects and analyses data and study documents, and provides reports in compliance with applicable requirements.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: NCI.  The National Cancer Institute, part of the National Institutes of Health of the United States Department of Health and Human Services, is the Federal Government's principal agency for cancer research.  NCI conducts, coordinates, and funds cancer research, training, health information dissemination, and other programs with respect to the cause, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of cancer.  Access the NCI Web site at http://cancer.gov.

Concepts.definition: The Federal Government's principal agency for cancer research. NCI conducts, coordinates, and funds cancer research, training, health information dissemination, and other programs with respect to the cause, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of cancer. Part of the National Institutes of Health of the United States Department of Health and Human Services.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An agency of the PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE concerned with the overall planning, promoting, and administering of programs pertaining to health and medical research.

Concepts.definition: A federal agency in the U.S. that conducts biomedical research in its own laboratories; supports the research of non-Federal scientists in universities, medical schools, hospitals, and research institutions throughout the country and abroad; helps in the training of research investigators; and fosters communication of medical information. Access the National Institutes of Health Web site at http://www.nih.gov.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Organizational unit like a laboratory, institute or consortium.

Concepts.definition: Organizational unit like a laboratory, institute or consortium.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 7/22/2021wz: released for UML model cleanup project.
